description: Borrowed from Latin lūgubris (“mournful; gloomy”), with the suffix -ious.

adjectives.description: lugubrious (comparative more lugubrious, superlative most lugubrious)

entries.meaning: Gloomy, mournful or dismal, especially to an exaggerated degree.
examples: His client’s lugubrious expression tipped off the detective that something lurked beneath her optimistic words.
